experience.title: Graduate Assistant - User and Research Services
experience.description: I've joined the team at my college library as a Graduate Assistant in the User and Research Services Department! Assisting patrons in person, over the phone, via email, chat, and text messaging at the Ask Us Desk. Equipped with knowledge of research resources both in the library and online, and helping patrons with various research approaches and strategies. Committed to delivering top-notch customer service with my verbal and written communication skills.As a supervisor at the circulation desk, I make smooth operations by keeping student assistants on task, managing financial transactions, and addressing patron issues. Ready to tackle projects and other duties as assigned, with a dedication to prioritizing work assignments while on the clock.

recommendations: Krishna Kishore Nunna “I am delighted to recommend Aishwarya for her outstanding work as a Graduate Assistant in the User and Research Services Department at Texas A&M University-Corpus Christi. Over the past 10 months, she has consistently demonstrated exceptional dedication and professionalism in assisting patrons both in person and remotely. Her extensive knowledge of research resources, combined with her excellent verbal and written communication skills, has made her an invaluable asset to our team. She excels in providing top-notch customer service, always going above and beyond to ensure patrons receive the help they need. As a Co GA at the circulation desk, she has shown remarkable leadership by effectively managing student assistants, handling financial transactions, and addressing any patron issues that arise. Her ability to prioritize work assignments and tackle projects with enthusiasm and efficiency is truly commendable. I have no doubt that she will continue to excel in her future endeavors, and I wholeheartedly recommend her for any role that requires dedication, expertise, and a commitment to excellence.”
